intro: Deutzia glomeruliflora var. lichiangensis, commonly known as the Lichiang deutzia, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and features slender, arching branches. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, turning yellow in autumn. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a suitable ornamental plant in gardens.
